extendedInfo.description: Kalnirnay (Marathi) is a Mobile version of the well-known Indian Religious Calendar Kalnirnay, for Solar and Vedic Lunar Events, synced to the Western Calendar system. It offers the following features: â¢ View of detailed information about Lunar Events â¢ View of monthly Panchang, Bhavishya and Vivah Muhurta â¢ Facility to set Reminders for Events of Interest â¢ Ability to take daily Notes and to set Reminders for the Notes â¢ Ability to view Events for Specific Religion â¢Â View of Yearly or Monthly Events grouped by Categories Notifications for Event and Note remindersToday's Date, System Month is highlighted for better User Experience

reviews.author: Rohit patil

reviews.title: Costly yet incomplete
reviews.comment: From the last year I m using this but this mobile version do not contain all the information which the print version have. I don\'t expect the articles and horoscope but the details about the given date in print version and that of in mobile version is far different so I can\'t not use mobile version alone I have to purchase print version spending @150 rupees for almanac per year is costlier deal. The publisher have to think about this. Also I spend another 100 bucks for purchasing this year\'s calendar.
reviews.author: Amarendra Joshi

reviews.title: Needs real improvements
reviews.comment: Its really a good app. but i think u ppl are just pasting new year calender. No software wise upgradation. Ppl are asking for zoom option and many more i think u dont bother. Please try to sync the same with google calender. dont act like punekar where customer is least valuable thing.
reviews.author: Mayur Joshi

reviews.title: Needs improvements

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.comment: I am very disappointed coz this release for updating should\'ve been released much early! I purchased the new 2013 version as there was no information available regarding this free update. This means that I\'ve spent my money unnecessarily and thats a loss to me because of lack of information from Expersis\'s team. Very poor handling of the release related  information and communications to existing users of the app.
